Croatia

Group D | Europe

Pašticada

Just like Mama Modrić used to make, this rich time-consuming sauce for gnocchi is worth the effort. We coulnd't get ahold of Luka's mom to get her exact recipe, but Mike Benayoun's should prove just as scrumptious.

It's said that in the Croatian region Dalmatia, Pašticada is reserved for special occasions and we think the World Cup definitely qualifies. To make is a real party, add a splash of Prošek, for good measure pour a shot for yourself too.

  • Time 2hrs 30mins
    plus marinate overnight
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Professional
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 450g Beef round
    1lb
    450g
    Beef round
  • 2 cloves Garlic
    2 cloves
    2 cloves
    Garlic sliced
  • 60g Bacon
    2oz
    60g
    Bacon diced
  • 2 Whole cloves
    2
    2
    Whole cloves
  • 475ml Red wine vinegar
    2 cups
    475ml
    Red wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp Flour
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Flour
  • 3 tbsp Olive oil
    3 tbsp
    3 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion quartered
  • 240ml Vegetable stock
    1 cup
    240ml
    Vegetable stock
  • 2 tbsp Tomato paste
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Tomato paste
  • 2 Carrots
    2
    2
    Carrots sliced
  • 200g Celeriac
    ½ lb
    200g
    Celeriac cubed
  • 120ml Red Wine
    ½ cup
    120ml
    Red Wine
  • 1 tbsp Sugar
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Sugar
  • 2 Prunes
    2
    2
    Prunes
  • 1 Bay leaf
    1
    1
    Bay leaf
  • 225g Gnocchi
    ½ lb
    225g
    Gnocchi
  • 1 tsp Parmesan cheese
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Parmesan cheese grated
  • 1
    The day before cooking, cut the beef lengthwise, leaving one side still attached, like a book. Insert sliced garlic, bacon and the cloves and close the beef. Place in a large dish and cover with the red wine vinegar. Cover the container and refrigerate overnight.
  • 2
    When ready to cook, remove the bacon and garlic from the beef and reserve for later. Cover the beef in a light layer of flour, bring the olive oil to a high heat and fry in a dutch oven until browned on all sides.
  • 3
    Remove the meat from the pot and fry the onion along with the reserved garlic and bacon for 10 minutes.
  • 4
    Return the beef to the pot with vegetable stock and bring to the boil.
  • 5
    Add tomato paste, carrots, celeriac, red wine and the sugar. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook for one hour.
  • 6
    Add the bay leaf and the prunes. Continue cooking over a low heat for a another hour.
  • 7
    The beef should now be on the verge of falling apart. Remove and cut into slices.
  • 8
    Fill a large saucepan with water and boil gnocchi. When gnocchi float to the top, they are finished.
  • 9
    Purée what's left in the pot in a blender.
    Coach's tip Make sure it is fully cooled before blending!
    Coach's tip Make sure it is fully cooled before blending!
  • 10
    Serve the sauce over cooked gnocchi with the beef on top. Top with the parmesan cheese
